On november 1, 2015
[6826491]

Welcome to the 14th iteration of this thread! Ask your simpler game questions here, and see them answered (usually!) This thread isn't intended for discussions about things like, "Which skill/project/research is best?" - you should create a new thread for discussions and debates about situational topics.

We use a particular format, so please be sure to number your questions and answers accordingly. Also, please attempt to search the forum before you ask; the answer may have been posted in a previous thread.

Format Example:

Person with a questionQ1: If the ship moves, and we don't arrive at a planet, what happens to the planets we scanned?

(Person with an answer) A1: Those planets are lost forever, and you have to scan for new ones.

Before you post, consider this:

You probably shouldn't reveal too many details about your ship in your question. If your character isn't an important part of your question, leave your identity out. Whether you're Mush should also be left out, unless the question directly relates to Mush activity.

If people need more details in order to answer your question, they'll ask for them.

We've seen FAR too many newbies post things like, "I'm so and so and Mush, and this is what's going on on my ship." before asking a question...without realizing that experienced people not only read the forum, they might also read that very question, and might be on your ship. That usually ends badly for the person asking the question.

On november 3, 2015

Why is there so little casting compared to meta in D2N?
On november 3, 2015
Chime

Is that a serious question? Because casting or not a ship needs 16 people to start. A new casting even needs 32 people to launch a ship and you have to invest quite a few tickets to fund one. I don't play D2N but I got the impression that a meta is a lot easier to establish (even though you still need organisation for it to work).
On november 4, 2015
DarkTheRaven

Technically for a meta to jump they need a minimum of 40 players (to fill a town), they also need to have numerous paying players as they are the only ones able to choose the towns they go to, so meta's organize smaller groups of 5 called coalitions where 1 player is paying and the rest arent, this allows them to also drag the other 4 members into the proper town as the 'ready' status in a coalition just allows the members to go to the same town

Adding onto why there are less castings, I feel like the Mush community is a lot less interwoven than the D2N one, most of the remaining meta players are beta testers or early beginners who all know each other as if they were a family, it's also helpful that they unlike castings are not limited because they can only be in one group at a time (if theyre not paying) as they typically just disband and reform coalitions to suit the need of every jump

Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Yes, they can spread a second time, but only if they do no damage. Fires can't do damage and spread at the same time.
On november 5, 2015
Lauxnos

In that case it should still spread to adjacent rooms of the original fire, should it not?
Otherwise it would be possible for the whole ship to catch fire in 1 cycle change and that would be a game breaking mechanic. Even though the chances would be extremely low.
On november 5, 2015
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

No, one fire cannot spread twice. It can either spread, cause damage, or do nothing. When it spreads, the second fire can in turn spread, cause damage, or have no effect. I would say that the chances are pretty equal, so it is possible to see the second and sometimes third fire(s) spread, but then they stop and either cause damage or do nothing.


Actually, the original question was wrong in itself. A fire in CC can only spread to AB or BB, not both. But you can have AB -> CC -> BB -> broken patrol ship.

I know if a room is guarded when you are outside then you can't return, but I think the reverse is true ((Enter bay from on-ship that is guarded and you can't take off))

On november 12, 2015
npfan
IrishpolakA12: As far as I'm aware, guarding only prevents you from entering or leaving, actions are unaffected. An exception is using a patroller, as each one is considered it's own room in-game. I know if a room is guarded when you are outside then you can't return, but I think the reverse is true ((Enter bay from on-ship that is guarded and you can't take off))

Guarding a room doesn't prevent people from entering or leaving, but restricts movement so that anyone entering a room can only leave the same way they came in. Patrol ships and Pasiphae are considered separate rooms as far as guarding is concerned, so if you're guarding a bay while someone is flying in space, the only 'rooms' the person in space can go to is the ship or the bay.

Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

You're confusing two things.

Sometimes traders ask specifically for Ian. That is an actual trade.

But they don't ask for Chun or Humanity's only hope. You saw that because when a character (any character) goes inactive, theirs skills are listed in the "items" available for sale. If Jin Su is idle, then you can see "Leader" or "Pilot" in the items. But traders never ask for skills, and usually ask for a random crew member.

None of that is specific to a mush comms officer, they see the exact same trades as everyone else. The only difference is that they can sell an active crew member who is in a storage room.

On november 27, 2015
Misterme7

A25. If someone ejects from a spacecraft, the craft is permanently stuck in space. If they die(like in a steel plate), the craft will also be stuck. This could also be a drone that used it's actions to shoot this turn. If a patrol ship is stranded in space, it will be reported in this he Bay it is from as broken, and can be repaired by a drone, but this heh is does nothing but waste drone time. If you have magnetic net, empty ships will follow you through space, but will not land. If you ever abandoned someone with net, they could have ejected but left you the craft in space.
On november 27, 2015
NERON

Q25 To answer the actual question, the landing action costs drone one "AP" where drones spend 1-2 AP per cycle. If it spent all of it past cycle killing the last hunter, it only has AP to land the following cycle

A32: Most of what everlasting said is true. If you run out of gold days, you lost possibility to pick 4 skills, additional max morale/hp. If you did pick up 4 skills before gold mode run out, you keep them until end of the ship. If you DID NOT pick up 4 skills, you lose that possibility when gold mode end.

So, if you don't die or get transfered and you pick 4 skills, 4 skills will be with you till end of ship.

Q54: Is there a difference between being rudely awakened and waking up calmly?
On december 27, 2015
[8281990]

A54: "Wakes up calmly" means a person was in a bed and got out of it (usually to perform an action, pick up an item, or leave the room). "Rudely awakened" means the person was previously inactive and logged into the game. It has nothing to do with being in a bed like the other message; it represents their character losing the inactive status.

On december 31, 2015
jmjms

Hey granny Orianna, Eleesha jmjms here.

Not exactly sure why the Ctrl+Enter isn't working for a regular new line, hopefully someone else can find an answer for you. Meanwhile I do have two things that may be of some use to you.

One is to try adding a space after the new line, followed by another Ctrl+Enter:

First Line *Ctrl+Enter*
*space, Ctrl+Enter*
Second Line

Usually I use this to add a full blank line in-between my sentences, though that may not be exactly what you're trying to do.

The second is to install the Ctrl+W script (please don't press those keys, it's actually the name of the script).

It's makes the playing experience so much better and there are buttons that automatically formats the text for things like Shelf contents and Project Results.

Link to Ctrl+W and other tools: http://mushpedia.com/wiki/Tools
On december 31, 2015
Sachiko

Thanks, I'll give it a try <3

Line 1 (ctrl+enter ctrl+enter)

Line 2 will appear here.

Q64: Do I get to choose my character for each new ship or am I stuck with my first choice?
On january 7, 2016
TeufelsAdvokat

A64: You can choose your character each new ship, unless you're addicted to that character. In which case you end up playing more than 2000 cycles as that character and only wait for that specific character to show up in your selection. A truly horrible fate... ._.
On january 7, 2016
[8281990]

A64: When you're looking for a new ship, the game gives you a list of up to 4 characters from one of the currently-incomplete ships to choose from. You can pick any character that you are randomly offered, it doesn't matter who you played before.

If you're only seeing one character, that means the ship you're being offered only has one person left to wake up. When you choose it, mush will wake up and the game will start. If you want a different character, wait a while and it should swap you over to another filling ship. This can take a long time, though.

Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?
AcebA75: Not sure at all, but after mutating, all skills are considered as LOST. (NOT SURE!)

Try not to reply if you're not sure, this is how urban legends spread.

Skills are not lost when a mush mutates. They lose the possibility to do any action apart from moving, attacking, sabotaging and accepting missions, but passive skills remain (shrink, logistics, hard-boiled, mycelium spirit...).

The only known exception is Wrestler. The bonus is lost, because it would be completely OP if Wrestler stacked with the mutation bonus. But no official information was given about Solid.

Q80: Is there any way to hold off on choosing human skills if you have an equal or greater number of skill slots than skills. i.e. You're gold (4 skill slots), character level 4 (4 skills), but will shortly be level 5 but the game autoselects all 4 skills for you. Any way to stop that from happening?
On january 16, 2016
[1820396]

A80: Sadly, no. Game will auto-select all your skills if you have same or less amount of unlocked skills then skill slots. There are basically only two ways how to circumvent it. First, don't level up to lower levels of character, that you don't want to have unlocked. Just wait until you get enough XP to level all the way up to 5th (or 6th) level in one go. Then you won't be forced to pick level 2, 3 or 4 skill. Or play for another character, in the meanwhile, and get enough XP with them.

On january 20, 2016
NERON

The fastest way is to find a casting doing 2h or 1h cycle mode. Each cycle is 1 (or 2 if gold) EXP and when the cycles are shorter, there are more of them in the day, which means you can gain EXP at 150% and 200% the normal rate respectively. This is also the most economic way to convert gold days into EXP

On the other hand, castings often require time to launch, which means you can't be gaining normal EXP from randoms

If you can't find a casting that fits the criteria, you'll have to do random ships and minimize your time not a on ship as much as possible

A97: The procedure I use is:

Text, ctrl+enter, space, Ctrl+enter, then the rest of the text. You can add more line breaks in the same manner. However, if you make any edits above a line break, it can screw up your formatting, and disrupt any line breaks made below the edit.

[9256417]

Q100!

Sometimes when I pick up the stainproof apron I get hurt. What causes that, and is there a way to avoid it?
On january 23, 2016
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Random injuries can happen when you pick up an item or carry out some actions (repairing, cooking, putting out fires, etc.). There is no way to avoid that, but you should never pick up an item or do anything when your health is below 3, not even a bandage or the medikit.
On january 23, 2016
NERON

A100! Picking up any item and some actions have a chance to deal damage to your person. The chances of this happening depends on the item or action. For instace picking up the cat or fixing a door have is more likely to feal damage than picking up a banana or showering. You can reduce these chances by having the gloves item in your inventory
On january 23, 2016
[8886413]
NERONA100! Picking up any item and some actions have a chance to deal damage to your person. The chances of this happening depends on the item or action. For instace picking up the cat or fixing a door have is more likely to feal damage than picking up a banana or showering. You can reduce these chances by having the gloves item in your inventory

It is an action [Strengthen], available on scrap metal. It adds 5 hull.

A129
So, you need that piece of metal scrap selected on the shelf, and there will be a Strengthten button. Take the Wrench in your inventory to improve the chance of success, and an Oscilloscope for better quality of repairment (improves the amount of added armor).

VinceA129
It is an action [Strengthen], available on scrap metal. It adds 5 hull.

Anyone can do it, but the base chance is low. Better with the Wrench, even better for a Technician.

On february 21, 2016
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Washing is not invisible but private (meaning that it's visible to you only). With Observant, Eleesha can only notice secret actions that were already visible and that sometimes happened several cycles ago, and reveal covert actions, like a camera, at the same time as the action takes place.

She cannot reveal private or invisible actions.

See the part about Observant and the illustrations in this tutorial.

Vince

On february 24, 2016
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

On february 24, 2016
[6826491]
VinceBut if a Mush eats, waits 2 cylces and eats again, they are full for 4 right?

No, they'll just be full for another two cycles. The mechanism for their Satisfaction is, "Any consumable makes the Mush full for two cycles, regardless of the Satisfaction rating of the consumable." So, eating Organic Waste will make them full for only two cycles, but so would coffee, a pill, or Jumpkin. Two cycle changes later, they can eat another Organic Waste, and be full for another two cycles.
On february 24, 2016
Vince

Alright.
In that case I guess everything they eat sets their satisfaction to 4, no matter where it was.
Rather than Organic Waste giving them +4 just like everything else.
On february 24, 2016
[6826491]

It's best to not assume that so definitively.

While we know for certain that a Mush that eats can eat again in two cycles, we don't know exactly how the Satisfaction works in the event that they are cured while full. Eating might not even set the Satisfaction to 4 at all. It would require repeated testing on co-op ship to confirm that.
On february 24, 2016
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Maybe it just gives them the "Full stomach" status, without giving them any satisfaction. The only things we know for sure about Mush and food are :
- they are full for 2 cycles when they eat ;
- their satisfaction decreases like human satisfaction, by 1 per cycle ;
- eating reseats their satisfaction to 0, again, like humans.

On february 25, 2016
Vince

How is the first confirmed when you don't know how satisfaction works on mush?

On february 25, 2016
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Since it wasn't clear, mush are full for 2 cycles every time they eat, whether it is 2, 3 or 10 times in a row.

As for the first point, I said that we don't know how satisfaction works when mush eat. But we do know that apart from that, mush have the same system as satisfaction as humans. They start at 0 and lose 1 per cycle. Humans starve when they reach -25. Mush don't starve but they still have a negative hidden satisfaction, that can decrease indefinitely.

There are several proofs of that.

- If you cure a mush who has never eaten in the last 3 days, they are hungry.

- Same thing if a mush transfers after not eating for 3 days ; their old body is hungry too.

- When the collective satisfaction of the crew reaches a certain (unknown) negative level, a "famine" alert is displayed. That never happens on random ships, but all the time on coop casting ships. The first time it appears, if one mush eats, the alert disappears. But it reappears again, and after a few cycles, if only one or two mush eat, the alert is still displayed, showing that the general satisfaction of the mush keeps decreasing.
On february 25, 2016
spacekadt
VinceHow is the first confirmed when you don't know how satisfaction works on mush?

Because there are confirmed cases of cured mush that haven't eaten being starving immediately upon cure.

Testing the latter would require a cure to happen while there's a satisfaction level of a determined amount. Which hasn't been tested or, afaik, observed.
On february 25, 2016
Vince

That's some interesting info there, thanks.

Should add that to the wiki as the best current theory.

Format Example:

Person with a questionQ1: If the ship moves, and we don't arrive at a planet, what happens to the planets we scanned?(Person with an answer) A1: Those planets are lost forever, and you have to scan for new ones.

Before you post, consider this:

You probably shouldn't reveal too many details about your ship in your question. If your character isn't an important part of your question, leave your identity out. Whether you're Mush should also be left out, unless the question directly relates to Mush activity.

On march 24, 2016
Cross

A142: You have an illness known as food poisoning. These can be cured by being healed. You can heal yourself by selecting yourself when holding the medikit, or while in medlab. Others can also heal you, which is more efficient than self healing. Many illnesses also clear up on their own with the passage of time.

A143: Janice is guarding the room, only allowing people to exit from the room they entered from. Until she stops guarding, the only options would be to kill her to get past, communicate and play the social puzzle to convince her to let you pass, go around if possible, or be Chun with the Sneak skill.

A144: This is an injury. This can be cured by someone with the Medic skill, or someone conducting surgery on you while you are laying down in medlab. You can conduct surgery on yourself by laying in medlab and selecting the DIY Surgery Pod, but again, it is more efficient for someone else to do it.

- Read the sticky threads. If you're not willing to read lots of text, this is definitely NOT the game for you. This is not a casual game in which you can check it once a day, and have nothing new happen since the last time. It's important that you know what's going on before you take action.

- Communicate with your crew before doing things randomly. Most players will be more likely to assist you if you're polite and receptive to their advice. Conversely, you've seen what happens if you do random things and ignore the advice you're given. That path usually ends violently.

- Communicate, communicate, communicate! Why am I repeating myself? Because the success of any ship depends on its crew to communicate and coordinate their teamwork. Silent players usually end up dead before the ship is over, and obnoxious/verbally abusive ones often end up dead first. People who ignore the important threads on a ship are a liability, in most cases.

If any of these are an issue for you, let this be your last ship. Seriously. You'll be doing the community a favor. If you follow this advice, you might become a productive member of the community.

[6826491]

A147: That list ("Finola's List", as it's also known) may display crewmembers as testing "Negative" at the moment of Mush selection. In other words, anyone displayed as Negative is not an Alpha. Here's the caveat, though: It's not a guarantee of humanity, since people can be converted, or be a Transfer victim. Finola's List can't reflect those changes. It's also independent of whether they started with a spore on them.

Q 156 What was the nerfing of Lethargy?
On april 3, 2016
[1820396]

A156: Few seasons back, Lethargy checked only at cycle change whether character was lying in bed and as long as they were in number of subsequent cycle changes, they got bonus. Now, it also checks whether they left bed during the last cycle, and if they did, it resets the number of cycles in bed needed to get bonus.
On april 3, 2016
Vince

A156
It now stops the chain whenever you do something, rather than when not ending the cycle in a bed.

Unless you need the bigger AP reserve, it's really not that great now.

spacekadt

After more thinking and throwing ideas about in our IRC channel, I don't think it matters when spores appear.

The current most-likely theory is that mush are chosen at selection. The best evidence for this is in the dev's remarks that newbies are less likely to be chosen as mush.

If spores appear pre-selection, the selection algorithm would have to ignore the spore count to determine the mush (again, making newbies less likely to be chosen) or the spores would have to be placed at selection time.

It's something that could be scienced for exact timing, but still wouldn't prove humanity or mush status.

[9338706]

Q172: What exactly happens if another player/mush attacks you while you offline. Does your character automatically fight back or is s/he just used as a punching bag. I read through the mushpedia and still haven't got an exact grasp on how combat works. Do people take turns once it is initiated or is it more like "I have enough action points saved up to kill you and you let your guard down so your toast" type of system lol.
On april 15, 2016
[8281990]

A172: It's the latter. That's why you'll often come under suspicion if you aren't spending enough AP for the ship - people will wonder what you're stockpiling for. It's also why it's best for humans to conduct mush hunting in small, private groups, so the mush will have little to no warning before being exterminated.

That being said, there are patterns to activity that you'll notice, so you don't have to constantly be refreshing. Cycle changes tend to being people around, because fresh AP and new ship events happen then. Day change (C8 > C1) causes once-a-day skills, many of them mushy, to refresh, and will probably come with an even bigger bump of activity. Of course, people will often take advantage of this and try to act at a strange time. Still, AP is limited, which prevents anyone from going too crazy... unless they're not being watched closely enough and know what they're doing.
On april 15, 2016
Vince

Still, if the Mush are hell-bent on killing you first, there is not too much you can do - except for wearing armor, which is why Chun (priority target) usually does that.

What you can do is make yourself a less attractive target, especially for body swapping, by not accumulating too many AP (especially as Derek or Chao, who should never do that anyway) or telling everyone what weapons you hold. Also you may not want to read that Shrink book to replace a missing Janice when you are also the only Technician left on the ship. That sort of thing.

And communicate! It is much easier to imitate or turn you if you are silent, and not report suspicious actions towards you. (E.g. people walking into you while you are not under a camera.)


The thing is, just killing someone is not enough for the Mush to win, unless they are like the only sane person on a chaotic ship. If they don't do enough damage in their rampage for the ship to be unable to return home, they lose.

So the safest course of action is to create an environment where the Mush have to wait for a better opportunity to act than just that in order to have a chance. And, ideally, never let that arise until you get them.

[6826491]

A173: They're not going to return with a known Mush aboard, full stop. That would be considered a human surrender, and it would be very much reportable. Likewise, to be an active alpha and do absolutely nothing to accomplish your team's goals would be poor Mush play. You can't win just by hoping for an infiltration - you have to make it happen, somehow.

If you're a beta, or an alpha Mush with Anonymush, that's a bit different. You could attempt an infiltration at that point, in hopes that they can't detect your Mush presence. The key point however, is that something to further the team's goals was accomplished.

A side strategy to this is to bide your time and complete Pilgred - either rushing it with the help of your Mush partner(s) or by completing a Pilgred trade as a Mush Comms officer. After it's complete, either hack the command terminal or be the Commander, and return the ship to Sol.

In short, you can't "win" through inaction.

[6826491]

A179: Yes, and this is one of the reasons to avoid the skill - there have been cases of the Traitor getting chosen for multiple negative events, due to the random nature of expos. The takeaway from this is that the skill can easily backfire on the Mush using it. That's not a guarantee that it will, of course; but I've witnessed it to be more harmful than helpful in most cases.

[6826491]

A187:

- Items may be moved, but may not be kept in inventory. Keeping non-personal items in one's inventory can be sanctioned as a Neutral Play violation. This is the primary action that is disallowed.

- The Mycoscan research is explicitly allowed, as is any other research or projects.

- Cameras can be placed in dorms or other important rooms.

Caurasse

Thank you, but I need some further details...
So, Q197 bis :


For Medlab, do you need a empty bed ? Does it appear in logs (with people in the room, of course) ?

You can heal yourself by:
1) Holding the medkit and using it on yourself (no logs created unless You have cured yourself from illness)
2) Eating Bananas / Jumpkings (Humans only)
3) While being in medlab, everyone has "ghost medkit" so they can heal themself or everyone (healing yourself again, don't give any logs visible to others)
4) When You mutate (as mush)
5) Naturally, every day change, You get +1HP
6) Every ship start with 2 bandages in medlab which heals 2HP (per use). People might notice that bandages have disappear and You risk being dirty (only healing by food/bandages can make You dirty, using medkit can't make You dirty)

Q189: how "smart" is Chaos' torturrer skill? What actions does it show? Also, for example, if a person lies down, wakes up, lies down, wakes up, lies down, does it show 3x lie down or just once? Is this universal?
On april 29, 2016
[9142061]

EDIT: Q190: Aceb, you sure there are no logs on healing? Wiki says the following: Icon Public log:
[Healer] has healed [amount]Health Point for [patient].
On april 29, 2016
PseudoDernier
Gentleman kawaiiiii

A189: The Torture action just gives you the raw list, if someone laid down three times in a row then you will have "Lie down, Lie down, Lie down". It reveals almost all actions except for picking up or dropping an object, examining anything, and IIRC a couple other obscure ones.
Note that waking up will only be revealed if you click the button, not if you click on the floor or do something that makes you wake up.

A190: That is if you heal someone else. Healing yourself results in a private log.

On april 29, 2016
[9142061]

Q192: what are the mechanics of the booby trap? Can items be selected to be trapped, or is it always the shelf that gets trapped? Both wiki and the game are ambigious. Wiki seems to suggest that any interaction with the room will trigger a trap. Does it though? Like walking through a door?
On april 29, 2016
Cross

A192: Once a room is trapped, there is a simple way to determine if an action will trigger the trap. If the action button that you click is located under your inventory, you will not set off the trap. If the action button you click is located under the game's Flash Graphical User Interface (the main game screen where you navigate rooms, etc.), you will set off the trap.

With all this in mind it becomes easy to determine that, for example, dropping an item will not set off a trap, but picking it up will. Uninstalling a camera will set off a trap but installing it will not (so a Mush with Nimble Fingers can covertly trap a room with a camera in it as long as no other characters are present). The list goes on and on, but follow the rules above and you will always have your answer.
On april 29, 2016
Cross

A192 (clarification): To clarify, despite the odd logs of the shelving unit being trapped, it is not items or shelving units that get trapped, but the entire room. For example, taking off in a patroller, accessing the NERON BiOS, extracting (but not injecting) fuel, examining a patroller, are all things that can trigger a trap, and it is simply the first qualifying action that can trigger a trap that will trigger the trap (meaning you cannot target your trap beyond what room you set it in).
On april 29, 2016
[9142061]
